Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: bubbyNY
Reviews.Content: When searching for a place to check in for our last day, we struggled to find the relaxation and a front-desk manager who were recommend a few things for our last day. Kelly was amazing. She showed us to a great room, recommended the spa, dinner, and the spa again with wine. It was amazing. She continued to check on us to ensure that the spa was an appropriate temperature. She even explained to us where the water was coming from and how it works. Thank you Kelly!!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff -Kelly helped us make the most of our trip!”
Reviews.Author: Sunbumps
Reviews.Content: Great bed & linens! We would have liked to take the pillows. Very quit too!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Fun-gal79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in late March, I came down with my cousin to visit wine country. We arrived late but the young lady at the desk was very friendly, she recommended Checkers for dinner and even gave us a 10% off the bill. it was very kind of her. Our room was very clean, neat somewhat quiet ( we were on the road side). We didn't get to enjoy the pool at night but the next day we took a dip in their pool, but it was rather cold so we used the sauna instead. Breakfast was nice, not many options to chose from and they use plates that are not Eco friendly. The morning clerk was also nice. He asked us about our day and what we were going to do which I thought was wonderful as some places do not take the time to make you feel at home. This place was delightful. I am sure to return in the summer when the weather is sunny and warm!! (rain all day in March) I am hoping that the next time around we can enjoy the Wine country with more time

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: C T H
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed out stay in this hotel. The room is very big, nice and comfortable. The man of the reception (sorry I don't remember his name) is super friendly and helpful. Would recommend anyone to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff & hotel with every amenity you need!”
Reviews.Author: Diane545
Reviews.Content: My mother and 2 sisters stayed at the Comfort Inn in Calistoga for one night while wine tasting and touring the area. Sean & Kelly (front desk staff at the Comfort Inn) were the MOST helpful people I have ever met and they made our stay very enjoyable. My mom forgot her toothbrush, but sure enough they had one for her. I asked if they had a wine opener we could use and was told there was one in the room. The room was clean and pretty much a standard room, but the friendliness of everyone is what sold me on this place. Unfortunately I did not have enough time to enjoy the steam room, sauna or jacuzi, but I would definitely stay here on my next visit. The town of Calistoga is very quaint and has a lot to offer. Castello di Amorosa (castle/winery) is a must to see! We ate dinner at the Calistoga Inn & Brewery and Kelly recommended ordering the Yankee pot roast, which was excellent. No lie...it was to die for. Tip: the "small plate" would be enough to feed two people. Before we checked out of the hotel, we had a hot breakfast of waffles, eggs, sausage, fruit, muffins, cereal...and much more. I couldn't believe all the amenities this hotel had for such a wonderful price and Sean & Kelly were so courteous, professional and two of the most helpful people I've met. Next time you're in Calistoga, check out the Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Visit in Calistoga, CA”
Reviews.Author: pennyrr r
Reviews.Content: My family and I just spent 3 nights and days at the Comfort Inn in Calistoga. We very much enjoyed the Inn...founnd it a great place to stay with young children which is not always the case in Napa Valley. Our room waslarge, well appointed, had absolutely wonderful beds and opened onto a warm, sunny courtyard adjacent to the pool and hot tub. The breakfast was expansive and included just about everything you could want. The Inn is located at the far side of Calistoga near the Silverado Trail. There are many wineries closeby and the town is within easy walking distance. Calistoga has great restaurants and spas and is a delightful, small, picturesque Nappa Valley town.

Reviews.Title: “Calistoga is wonderful and this works”
Reviews.Author: MarianneO22448
Reviews.Content: The motel is on Lincoln which is the main street in Calistoga. Very friendly town with local coffee, brewery and restaurants. This can be a stop off point for Napa and the Silverado Trail. Comfort Inn was fine and the price worked for us

Reviews.Title: “Basic OK lodging in upper wine country”
Reviews.Author: ptbooth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as there was not much else available on short notice in the Calistoga/St. Helena area for a cooking class at the nearby Culinary Institute of America. The property is not very big, basically a motel in Calistoga. Similar to those other motels in smaller towns that offer free internet and the basic breakfast options (continental, some egg/sausage product, waffles), but with rooms that are rather worn. Our room had no view (on the ground floor, so kept curtains closed), and was rather cold in February (particularly the bathroom) unless we kept the heater on, which with the fan shutting on and off was somewhat annoying (unless you set it to continuous fan, which I did not). Did not partake of the mineral pool etc. Overall, OK place to sleep a night, but I wouldn't consider it great for a real vacation unless you're really on a tight budget or have few other options.

Reviews.Title: “Generic stop in lovely surroundings”
Reviews.Author: CAScientist
Reviews.Content: I'm always torn about how to review hotels that I visit on a special. Do I judge them based on their standard rate, or should I review them based on what I actually paid to stay there? I lean towards the former, and so I will judge this property based on it's advertised rate. On that scale I think it falls short. Admittedly it is an expensive area, but the property is dated and generic. The hotel is functional, the staff is polite. It's within walking distance of downtown, but be aware that for half of that distance there is no sidewalk, there is just a very wide shoulder on the road.There is a complimentary breakfast, but on the morning I was there the lobby was so packed with guests it was a hassle. The coffee was so bland that my companion and I drove into downtown Calistoga to buy more acceptable coffee to start our day. (and I wouldn't consider us coffee snobs) The wood in some areas is showing it's age. A couple boards in the stairs were flexing quite a bit and a board on our balcony made me wary of standing on it. Speaking of the balcony: it was cute but it fronted the main road, so the main view was of cars and the glass didn't do much to block the sound of traffic, even at night. Speaking of noise, the walls are very thin. While we couldn't make out words (thank goodness) we could tell every time the people in the room next to us were talking, or snoring. The cleanliness was less than hoped for, with multiple hairs on the wall in the shower. It took almost 10 minutes for the water to turn warm in the morning. When we turned the heat on at night, the obvious scent was of barbecue sauce. None of this would have mattered at a cheap motel. But for a Comfort Inn that charges this much per night, it was surprising. I wouldn't stay here at their listed rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, tired pool”
Reviews.Author: denisefromnapa
Reviews.Content: We spent the night at the Comfort Inn January of 2012. Sean, the receptionist was friendly and helpful, the lobby was well lit and welcoming. Room was fine, with warm colors and comfortable bed, but the next morning when the pool was finally open (9:00 am opening is kind of late since checkout is 11:00) we trekked down to find the pool (which Sean explained was kept at 90 degrees, and the hot tub which was set to 104, were both much cooler. We huddled in the mineral water hot tub while staff turned up the heat. The entire pool area is in need of updating and cleaning. Mineral pools are hard to keep fresh looking, but these pools looked a little shoddy. Breakfast was average, checkout was easy. Would we go back? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: travelgogo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, good variety for the free breakfast-we had a room in the back to avoid the street traffic noise-and it was quiet. Hotel is out of the hustle and bustle of downtown areas- the front desk, Sean Sullivan, was extremely friendly and helpful. We would go back- and we got a senior rate of $98 + taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Beaverfan62
Reviews.Content: We arrived after dark. The desk person made a dinner recommendation for us and it was wonderful. She also printed out our route to our next destination. We didn't have any time to spend in Calistoga but it looked very cute and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: LorrifromWelcome
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, Calistoga is a cute town, had a great time here. You can drive right through Napa, and lots of wineries and end your day here. The hotel is a little run down, could use a face lift. It was over priced, but most places were expensive in this area. The bed was comfortable. It had a little free breakfast in the morning which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: kobuse
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Comfort Inn. Good value for money and surprisingly well appointed in a otherwise reasonably expensive area. Rooms well clean and spacious and the service was superb. Wifi-reception was good and the staff were very helpful. The Inn also has a spa and swimming pool leading out from the rooms on the ground floor. It is located within walking distance from the main street. This property is recommended for the budget conscious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little bargain in an over priced area”
Reviews.Author: Saturday8
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days in September 2011 as a getaway to take it easy and look about town. The room was just as expected; it was clean and comfortable. We were in room 203. The morning breakfast was good with a good variety. The pool and hot tub were clean and refreshing although there was some traffic noise. I would definitely ask for a room away from the street as there are large trucks that use this street going to and from the wineries and for general delevery. The price was the best we found for a nice room in Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tnrtaylor
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great place to keep within a budget, The Comfort Inn is a steal! We were warmly welcomed when we arrived and taken care of all through out the stay. The room was cute and CLEAN. The beds were comfortable and the linens were awesome. The mineral pool and jacuzzi hit the spot after a long day on the vineyards and the sauna and steam room help you sober up. I will stay here every time I come to Napa! Thank you management for such a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: PeterS24
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful check in. Room very quiet, clean, and with a comfortable bed. Breakfast was basic but edible. We stayed just for one night, but would certainly be happy to return here as a base for a longer Napa tour. It definitely exceeded our expectations for a Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than we'd expected, very good deal”
Reviews.Author: moot54
Reviews.Content: We'd expected bargain rooms for our stop after a day of wine touring, but were pleasantly surprised by the appointments in our rooms. Everything was there, including robes, safe, fridge, and various other amenities. The beds were very comfortable, the venue was clean and quiet (except for the guys on Harleys starting up early morning, despite them trying to be quiet you just can't turn over a Harley quietly), and there was even an edible breakfast included (be sure to ask if there are made-to-order specialties, I only learned after I'd finished eating that they were cooking fresh waffles upon request). We'd neglected to bring bathing suits or we could have used the spa. Well located, pleasant helpful staff, a definite positive surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: lite29
Reviews.Content: My recent trip to Calistoga was a family affair. One room with 2 beds, one room with a king size bed and one suite were utilized during the stay. This area of California is very expensive, though I was still shocked to learn how expensive the rooms are at this Comfort Inn. That said, for a Comfort Inn, the rooms were roomy, the beds were comfortable, the linens and towels were high quality and the staff was accommodating. The housekeeping were cleaning our rooms before we left for the adventures of the day. The room keys, though, were awful. They usually didn't work, having to try over and over again before it would take. Having to go to the front desk at least 3 times to get them remagnetized. The pool was great, naturally heated. I wasn't bothered by the green color, as the water felt so good. The jacuzzi was also very nice. The chaise lounge chairs were ok. The three times I was at the pool area, in the late afternoon, it was mostly just my family at first before others arrived. The location to the little town of Calistoga is convenient and walkable, though there are no sidewalks. Because of this we would drive into town for dinner, not walking to walk on the side of the street at night with kids. Though I did the walk myself 3 times during the day and it was ok. I also went for jogs in the morning over on the Silverado Trail road up the street from the Inn, which also didn't have sidewalks but was very quiet and lovely that time of the day, before the wine tours begin. The breakfast was plentiful, though standard. There were hot eggs and sausage and you could request a waffle be made for you. Otherwise it was breads, cereal, yogurt and oatmeal. The Inn also offers a computer in the breakfast dining area for free, which was convenient to be able to check-in on line and print our boarding passes. The suite could use an upgrade, as the little kitchen didn't provide any plates, glasses or utensils, there was no microwave and the sink leaked. Also the air conditioner was old. It was nice they had a dvd player in the suite and the room proved useful as a gathering place for the family. Keep in mind there is no elevator, just stairs, and the courtyard setting can be bit noisy with people/kids congregating in the courtyard throughout the day. Also, the speedway is nearby and when they have races, you can heard the very loud cars buzzing all the way up to after 10p at night. I believe they only have races certain times of the year, and would imagine the other hotels on that side of the street have the same problem as it's also close together.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive but basic”
Reviews.Author: PeachyPeterborough
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property on September 8, 2011. We wanted inexpensive accommodations and for Napa Valley at $140/night this was a pretty good bargain. Check in was prompt and friendly. The rooms are basic and dated, in need of a makeover. Yet everything was clean...we basically just crashed for the night and left the hotel early in the morning at 6 am. If you rather spent your money on wine and touring while in Napa this hotel is a great alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Would not book at this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: Anibas44
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with friends. Room was overpriced, and very loud overlooking a parking lot. Bathroom door did not close properly and although it was clean the grout and tile clearly needed updating. Did not use pool or hot tub. Bed was comfortable. Check in/out was fine - person was helpful. Breakfast was usual fare for hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Booked for two nights but wanted to cancel the moment we arrived.”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi04NZ
Reviews.Content: The room is spacious however the bathroom could certainly do with an upgrade. The hotel pool is a disgrace - it is yellow colored and very unappealing.

Reviews.Title: “Good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: Although the view onto the parking lot was not great, the room was clean and the beds were extremely comfortable (the best during our 2 week trip, in fact). The included breakfast was very good with plentiful choices (sausage patty, scambled egg patty, english muffins, waffles, cereal etc). The pool was quite warm (which may not be appreciated by those who want a refreshing dip after a hot day cycling) and there were both dry and steam saunas. It was a short walk to the shops and restaurants. This motel is close to the Silverado trail, which is good for biking in the Napa valley. Staff were friendly and accommodating. We would return to this motel, which was a good value for the area..

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: sportyjo30
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night and would recommend the hotel to other travelers in Calistoga. The location is walking distance to town and the hot tub was great. The down comforters were excellent. The only issue we had is that an extra bed/cot was not available, even though I was told at the time that I made a reservation (via the comfort inn central booking number) that it could be arranged

Reviews.Title: “Was enjoyable - pricey - but so is the whole town!”
Reviews.Author: Pastorjackf
Reviews.Content: I will admit - I am from midwest and not used to such high prices! Hotel was very comfortable - good beds, clean rooms, friendly staff. No microwave in rooms-lobby had one we used. To eat in town was out of my teacher budget! Pool was small - but was warm mineral water - and did make you feel very relaxed. Was there on July 4 - town had a good parade - Kinda Norman Rockwell type feeling! Fair grounds was open with the county fair in progress. Was interesting to walk thru exhibits. Very good fireworks show that night. We stayed 2 nights at hotel. If you like to get away from it all - you might look at this one!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn Calistoga, 2009!”
Reviews.Author: MsAMuseBouche
Reviews.Content: This hotel was kind of clean, but has dirty carpets, old and needs lots of work! There are much better places to stay in Calistoga, nice sleepy litte town! You get what you pay for! We are going back this month and are staying at the Eurospa and Inn, so I will let you know how it goes!

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel in the Napa region”
Reviews.Author: BH91
Reviews.Content: As you probably might guess, hotels are VERY expensive in Napa Valley. I travel to the area several times a year and always stay at this property. Is it the fanciest place around...NO! However, the rooms are always clean and the staff is very helpful. All in all, a great value for your money. I will continue to stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine hotel in a pricey area”
Reviews.Author: Phil R
Reviews.Content: The area around Calistoga and St. Helena is one of the prettiest in California. The problem always is finding a reasonably priced place to stay. Comfort Inn in Calistoga is that place. The hotel is located on the far edge of Lincoln Ave, almost to the Silverado Trail, a bit outside of "downtown" Calistoga, but the location ensures quiet. Our room, on the second floor, was large, with a refrigerator, flat screen TV, and a lttle balcony. The kingsized bed was comfortable. The bathroom was basic, but adequate. The hotel has a little outdoor sitting area and a small pool. Free wireless internet is available in the rooms. Breakfast, consisting of juice, cereal, fruit, pastries, hardboiled eggs, and made to order waffles, is available from 7 to 10 am in the lobby. The only negative I can find is that the towels were somewhat stiff and rough, perhaps from being laundered without fabric softener.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE FOR A REST!!!”
Reviews.Author: photogal2330
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night. I booked the 'Balloon Package' ... on first arrival - my first impression was that it looked better in the pictures. But I understand that is the rule of marketing. I had a pleasant stay here... :) The room fit its purpose. I was comfortable, and felt safe. The room did have an interesting smell to it ... but nothing that I thought was offensive. It was nice to be able to come back to the room and watch movies on HBO on the nice flat screen TV. The gal that checked me in was very nice and allowed me the late check out because of the balloon ride. :) The next morning... when the balloon ride was cancelled due to high winds, I was a bit worried about weather or not I would have issues with the hotel regarding my package deal, but there were no problems at all and the guy that checked me out was very helpful as well. All around I had a very pleasant experience. A nice, affordable, quiet room in beautiful Calistoga! :) THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible, needs TLC...”
Reviews.Author: soHumboldt
Reviews.Content: stayed a few nights here with family from east coast. motel is nothing to write home about, but is ok. deep cleaning hasn't happened in a long time, or so it seemed. dust, dirt on shower tiles, carpets not edged in a while. really odd chairs (if you've stayed you know what i'm talking about...) bed was better than many. room was a good size, quiet, had what we needed, could and did walk to downtown calistoga without a problem. been to calistoga a lot. used to do dr. wilkinsons until they priced themselves beyond their value. so sad that happened... would recommend, but would advise to try others as well...

Reviews.Title: “Surprising value for comfortable accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Athena222
Reviews.Content: Opening the door to our room was a real surprise. Roomy, king bed, quiet. Front staff was very helpful, accommodating our request for a room away from the road (okay, there was almost no one there because we were way-off-season). Good bathroom, refrigerator in room, comfy bed, flatscreen t.v. Breakfast was included, with the option of fresh waffles. At under $100 per night, a real value for the area. Location was not on the main drag, but very close. Spa treatment we opted for was three blocks away -- not too far to drive in our melted state. A convenient launching place to wine country too. Recommend unequivocably, even when higher rates apply.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Lodge”
Reviews.Author: lovebudgettravel
Reviews.Content: We chose the Lodge because it offered the best rate and we trust Clarion over independent small motels/inns that offer comparable rates. When we decided to go Calistoga, the first thing in our list for a hotel is to have a hot spring pool and hot tub. The Lodge made the cut and we were extremely happy with our decision as we had a great stay at the Lodge. We saw a lot of other inns and motels around and we were glad that we chose the Lodge because some other motels/inns seriously need a face lift and updating! The room at the lodge is spacious, clean and nice. It looks exactly like what they put in the website. It has a refrigerator and a coffee maker, plasma TV..nice :) The lobby is also beautiful and cozy with nice furnitures. We enjoyed the heated pool, hot tub and steam room at night (close at 10PM daily). You might want to request a room that's not right by the pool because you would probably hear people chattering in the pool until 10PM (assuming people are swimming until that time). When we were there we got the pool and hot tub just for ourselves as most people don't probably want to swim at night. The pool was heated though..so we were totally comfortable. Our room was across from the pool and it was quiet, but very convenient to get to the pool, perfect location! We were extremely impressed with the FREE breakfast. They had everything from cereals, hard-boiled eggs, bagels, muffins, toasts, pastries, fruits, milk, orange juice, apple juice, and FRESHLY MADE WAFFLES!! We got there around 9:50 (breakfast ends at 10) and there were still plenty of food. We will certainly stay here again if we're at Calistoga. I heard they will change their name, hopefully the new management will maintain the quality service that Clarion has offered.

Reviews.Title: “Room clean but hotel lacking”
Reviews.Author: desertstamper
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the bed was comfortable, but the reviews neglected to state that there were NO inside stairs and NO elevator at all. It was raining the whole time we were there so we were having to carry suitcases up an outside staircase in the rain. The check in clerk had such an accent and was in such a hurry, that we could barely understand her. Breakfast selection was very limited. The heat in our room didn't work well. The thermostat said it needed service, but when we got the maintenance person up to the room, it wasn't indicating that, so we gave up and dealt with the noise and the fact that it took a long time to warm up the room. Also, the hotel was virtually empty, but we were given a room near the street and had quite a bit of road noise.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here - You & Your Belongings Are At Risk!”
Reviews.Author: alexgol99
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at this hotel a year ago. We planned a relaxing and lovely weekend in beautiful Calistoga to celebrate a friend's birthday. We checked into the hotel in the late afternoon and a woman greeted us at reception. She asked us many questions about our stay, plans, where we had gone in town, etc. We thought she was being friendly and we were pleasantly surprised this "average" hotel had apparently "above average" service. We left for dinner at 7pm and returned around 10pm. We returned to the hotel tired but excited to ring in the New Year. Our happiness and excitement quickly turned into extreme stress after discovering 2 out of our 3 rooms were robbed of credit cards and cash. We immediately called the receptionist and she placed us on hold as she called for the on-site manager. After being on hold for more than 10 mins, one of us went to the front desk and found the receptionist at her car leaving the facility. We called the police and woke up the on-site manager to help us get to the bottom of this robbery. After a hotel audit of all of our rooms, it was revealed that the MASTER KEY (that only the manager and the front desk have) swiped into ALL OF OUR ROOMS within a 20 minute period of when we left for dinner. We filed a police report and over the past year, we have tried every way possible to get the hotel management to reimburse us for both the money that was stolen and the total amount we were charged for our stay. As many people have mentioned in there reviews, we want to emphasize that the on-site manager, receptionist and staff are extremely unhelpful. This establishment is the WORST hotel we have ever stayed at and we hope you take this review seriously. If you want to stay at a safe hotel, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive/Good Help”
Reviews.Author: RVIDI
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my wife and I have been to Napa Valley. We had enough points through Choice Hotels to stay free at this hotel. Pulling into the parking lot, my first impression was the place looked past its prime. To some extent, this is true. It surely is not a grand hotel or resort. If you are looking for an inexpensive, nice hotel in a good setting, this is a fine choice. The rooms are big enough and I enjoyed the balony in the early mornings. There is a decent free breakfast. The courtyard is a nice place to have breakfast or even have some wine at the end of the day. The manager on duty was very helpful with all requests, including asking for a blanket so we could go to a local winery for an outdoor movie. I would reccommend this hotel for anyone on a budget but when we return, I would look to stay somewhere else. We really enjoyed staying in Calistoga. Out of all of the towns we visited, we felt Claistoga was the most quaint. Great shops and some nice restaurants. When tasting wines, we would head south and work our way back north. One day we took the St Helena Hwy, the other Silverado Trail. I would stay in Calistoga again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Clean”
Reviews.Author: hwday
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just outside town, but within walking distance to downtown. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. My only complaint was I had a room located along the main road and it was somewhat noisy even with the windows closed. I would recommend getting a room on the backside of the hotel away from the road. I would also recommend the breakfast, but you might also miss out on some good eats in town. Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, and reasonably price”
Reviews.Author: dduvernay
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my husband and his parents. Stayed for four nights. It was a little small for four adults with lots of luggage. But it was clean, had a great breakfast and refridgerator and comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pthomas57
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night while wine tasting in the area. The front desk was very accommodating, and helpful with directions to eateries. Our room was very comfortable. And we were nicely surprised to have a small patio with chairs. The hotel has the charm of a bed and breakfast, without the high price. Although you should request a room away from the street as were heard the traffic in the early morning. The belgium made to order waffles were terrific! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced.... and bring your own wine opener”
Reviews.Author: kmac7484
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent week in the Sonoma/Napa area and this was the third place we stayed. It was by far the most expensive at $270, and by far the worst location and lodging experience of the three. Although our room was quite spacious, it had a bad musty odor and the AC unit was very loud and rattled. We had to repeatedly get up during the night to turn it on to cool the place, and then turn it off so that we could sleep. Our television also kept turning off. Being that we were in wine country, we wanted to have some wine in our room before heading out to dinner. They did not provide openers in the room, so we went to the front desk for one. The receptionist was somewhat rude and replied "we used to have one, but someone never brought it back." I'm sorry, but just about every decent hotel I've stayed in has had a wine opener, and if you're a hotel/b&b in the Napa region, it should be a no-brainer. The pool was okay, but the hot tub water was very yellow... not sure if it was due to the lining/paint in the hot tub or something else, but you couldn't have paid me to go in it. We looked down on the pools from our room and there was a definite difference in water... Also, the pool towels were tiny. Breakfast was good, we really enjoyed the waffles. Some fruit would have been nice. Location wise, it was too far of a walk to downtown on a very poorly lit street at night. It wouldn't be a bad walk during the day with the right shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a trip down to Napa”
Reviews.Author: fireguy329
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night at the beginning of our journey down to Napa. Nice little town for a stopover. It would be a long walk to town if you choose to do that. The hotel was very clean, staff were great, room was a good size. It had a pool and a hot tub and we were in a very quiet part of the hotel. Contential breakfast was included, but very skimpy on items available. This hotel was close to a number of wineries in the area including "The Castle and Sterling wineries. It was a little expensive,although it was one of the more reasonabally priced for this town of expensive places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this MOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jennrogers
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. They present it as a lovely spa hotel but it's a glorified roadside motel. Spend a little more and get a lot more elsewhere. We arrived late and walked into a room that was over 90 degrees. I called the front desk to see if there was something wrong with the AC unit but was informed the AC is an energy efficient unit and only works if someone is in the room. But basically they have the cleaning service turn it off. I asked to speak with the manager who at first refused to speak to me. He then called and argued with me. NO CUSTOMER SERVICE AT ALL. He eventually gave me a whopping 15% off of a $259 room. Needless to say, we were up with the AC wall unit on all night. Wide awake at 5 a.m. we got up and left for home. It's not a great place to stay. It is very clean but VERY dated. Next time I'll pay more and stay at Solage.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for Napa exploration.”
Reviews.Author: Niall
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and the purpose was to locate in an area which was convenient to the rest of Napa and well priced also. The Lodge fitted the bill, Day one we spent in the northern half of the valley and day two, the southern half and visited the wineries we had picked. The Lodge is just on the fringe of Calistoga, 1 minute in the car or 5 minute walk. The room was on the 2nd floor, well maintained, and very spacious. No complaints at all, breakfast was very busy, but you could get it and bring it back to room, if their was no seating in a small dining area. Great spot and would recommend it, pool available for those who did not want to travel around the place. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Check the room first”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Norseman
Reviews.Content: Dropping into Calistoga one late Monday evening from a continuous drive from Portland, Oregon, we stopped at the first decent looking hotel and see what was available. Many rooms were available, the miltary discount took care of all the additional fees and taxes, and the room (#117 or #119 - I forget the exact number), was clean and ok for the price. The bed wasn't. After a whole night of not being able to sleep due how soft, no, destroyed would be more apt, that the mattress was, I was not happy. I thought the whole bed was that way, as my partner sleeps on an incredibly soft mattress and I thought she was just used to it. Nope, her side was wonderful I found out (way too late). So check the room first, as we did every room after that on our trip to Napa. Oh, and no matter what the desk clerk tells you, it is NOT within walking distance to downtown. Unless you're a speed walker. Drive, as parking was plentiful in this incredibly quaint and fun town. This was just a quick one nighter here before we hit Healdsburg the next day, so I'm not sure if I'd stay here again or not. Maybe. But I'd check the bed first.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: ltinanyc
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Lodge. Calistoga is a right near the vineyards, even though it is more north of the valley. The room decor reminded me of the Renaissance hotels. Free Wifi. Belgium waffles with the continental breakfast. The pool is a little small but has a sauna, steam room and jacuzzi. The Lodge is quaint with a garden and looks nicer than the other hotels in the area. Staff was nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: 32630Nana
Reviews.Content: We reserved two rooms and didn't think they came close to the description on the web site. At least the bed was comfy but the pillows were worn out. The continental breakfast was sparse and there were no indoor tables. They had a construction crew going full blast when we arrived but there had been no mention of this when we reserved the room. We had ask for two rooms close together but they put us on opposite ends of the complex even though the couple checking in before us was my neighbor. I think you can do better for the price charged at this motel who describes itself as a "lodge".

Reviews.Title: “Travelzoo deal was great!”
Reviews.Author: Pat076
Reviews.Content: Received an offer from Travelzoo for hotel and wine tour package. Was a great deal! Front desk person was so nice and really helpful with lots of ideas of things to do and where to eat. Great personality! Room was nice and clean. Stairs outside need some work but all in all, it was reasonable, clean and worth the trip. Beautiful area as well. Location is a little out of town but not too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, bad coffee and not good for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: ericamcarr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the last 2 nights. My reservation and check in were super easy. I had a very pleasant experience with the front desk man. He got me checked in asap and offered advise of where to eat if I wasn't familiar with the area etc. The room we were given was on the ground floor by the pool. We had to get up super early so we started to unwind around 8pm. I noticed a loud banging noise that went on about every hour that shook the walls and I thought maybe it was a heating unit or motor that needed to be fixed. My first call down to the front got me a very snotty woman who didn't care what the problem was, but said she could move me - that was my ONLY option. Since we had already unpacked and had taken showers I didn't want to go through all of that. But then we noticed that the traffic going down Lincoln was very loud and disruptive - so very thin walls! On our bed we only had a sheet and comforter (which of course I always remove when I go to hotels). No extra blankets in the room. After the banging came back on, I knew I'd never get any sleep if I stayed in this room. I called back down and got either a different woman, or someone who decided being snotty was not a good idea. She told me she has had SEVERAL guest who are light sleepers complain about that room and that it was nothing outside (she checked?) and it must be the room above me -their bathroom fan which goes on automatically. She brought us new keys and said no problem. We moved to a room upstairs with no guests on either side. It had not only top sheets and comforters BUT blankets too! Also it smelled better + had a brand new flat screen. It also had more towels. So we were happy with that. I couldn't sleep there - too loud for those who are light sleepers, as other reviews had mentioned. Do bring earplugs if you stay here. Although we were told about the free breakfast, a packaged danish and thick carbo bagel doesn't not sound good - nor did the dry cereal choices. I love good coffee in the am, but having to grind our own beans in the room was not the best idea. First of all if you are going to grind your own beans, at least make the coffee good. Blech. And if you have a fridge in the room, at least offer creamer instead of the powdered kind - blech again. :(. I would not stay here again - I'll pay extra to get extra.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SDblondie
Reviews.Content: calistoga was the perfect place to stay while wine tasting for a couple days, and this hotel was an excellent value. clean room, comfortable bed, hair dryer, fridge, iron, and free internet. the breakfast was ok- bagels, waffles, apples. very quiet also.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my Expectations”
Reviews.Author: mooth
Reviews.Content: I liked this place. I had no issues, and I was probably looking for them, because I read all the reviews. Our room looked just like the picture on the website, with upgraded linens and curtains. The bathroom was big and had a lighted makeup mirror. The mineral pool and hot tub were nice after a hike to Table Rock. It's not super luxurious or ritzy, but I didn't pay full rack rate either, so I wasn't expecting lavish. Liked the quiet location, too. Small cons: Fitness room looked lame and a tree branch obstructed our view from our balcony so we couldn't see the mountains.

Reviews.Title: “Low budget but fairly clean”
Reviews.Author: HL950
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, you're staying here if you can't afford (or don't want to pay) upwards of $300/night in wine country. And I don't blame you - I didn't this time, either. But I'm sorry to say that the Lodge at Calistoga was actually worse than it appeared on the website and in reviews. It definitely has a Motel 6-ish quality to it. Old comforters, dark carpet, noisy air conditioner. The beds were more comfortable than they looked and it was clean (although the extra glasses they gave us looked super dirty and we sent them back). Be warned that there is no elevator I know of. We had to carry our suitcases up a flight of stairs. Um, that alone is a deal breaker. What?? Breakfast is standard continental. There was someone there to make waffles, though. Coffee, bagels, hard boiled eggs, cereal and apples. We didn't stop in for breakfast. A really easy walk into town for dinner or shopping. It is a nice location in a peaceful setting. I probably would not stay here again, and choose to spend $50-75 more for a more upscale hotel, but I'm sure that most people who stay here are happy with their choice.

Reviews.Title: “A motel experience”
Reviews.Author: NZLA
Reviews.Content: The Lodge, while adequate in every way, is decidedly average. I had a hard time justifying the price- anywhere other than wine country this place would be outrageously overpriced. Even knowing I was paying wine country prices, I was annoyed at how little we were getting for our money. --cheap 80s decor- think Motel 6 --old flat pillows --scratchy sheets --thin scratchy towels- some with stains --hair from previous guests on shower wall (Bring flip flops for shower- it's that kind of place!) The staff were nothing to write home about- not rude certainly, but didn't seem to go out of their way to be friendly. We didn't eat the breakfast, but I had a look at the offerings. Styrofoam bowls, plastic spoons, cereal and store-bought bagels. Yuck. The location was good- albeit a walk into town. If you're looking for a "cheap" bed and not much more, this is probably a decent place. But if you want any sort of charm, style or romance, pay a little more and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “what a bargain”
Reviews.Author: fsba20
Reviews.Content: We booked this on Hotwire and got it for a good price, we were delighted when we got there and checked in. We had a good sized room, very comfy bed and nice bed linen. Free wi-fi and a fridge in the room also. we liked the location as we had come to visit a few of the vineyards and the majority of them were not far away and it was much cheaper here than staying at St Helena or Napa itself. Breakfast was fine, nothing fancy but it did the trick for us. We ate this outside both mornings sitting in the sun and reading the free paper.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive for the area, clean, friendly and great pool”
Reviews.Author: bronandmatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Clarion Lodge in Calistoga at the end of March. Friends were getting married at a nearby Winery and it was a great experience. The rooms are quite expensive, but Calistoga is not a cheap town and it was great value for the area. Three of us shared a room and we had plenty of space, the balcony over the pool area was great.. There was a good sized fridge, the bathroom was spotlessly clean and the beds were really comfortable. Breakfast was simple, but really tasty. The best thing about this hotel however, was the pool. It was small and not impressive looking but because it was a mineral pool rather than the normal chlorinated soup it was a lovely experience, warm, soft and actually good for the hair and skin rather than otherwise, and because it was open until 10pm it was a great place to chill out in the evening and post rehearsal dinner. The Clarion is only a short walk to Calistoga main town and although the road is dark at night, you do get a great view of the stars.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive for Calistoga, but still not a good value.”
Reviews.Author: patay13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights, a family of four. Overall was OK. We kept reminding ourselves "we should have paid a bit more" for all the 'little things' that make a difference. Positives: - very comfy queen beds, OK sized room - good A/C - inexpensive (for Calistoga) - friendly, helpful desk staff - pool towels and bathrobes - good water pressure in the shower - the kids liked the waffles at breakfast - jacuzzi and pool area stay open until 10pm - easy check-in and check-out - nice large in-room refrigerator (rectangular-shaped) Negatives: - TV took awhile to warm up before the picture came through - only 3 rough bath towels per room - only 2 drinking glasses allowed per room. We asked for two more but were refused. - automatically charge $1.50 per night for the in-room safe. If you choose not to use it you have to remember to ask for an adjustment to your bill upon checkout. - thin walls - closet was so small our suitcase almost didn't fit inside. - pool: funky green color, too much chlorine, not skimmed - bugs floating in it. - poor WiFi connection - kept losing the connection in our room - stairs and upstairs walkways are uneven and look run-down. You had to watch your step on the stairs because they were built with uneven heights between one step and the next.

Reviews.Title: “Was better As A Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: UKPeripatetic
Reviews.Content: I have happy memories of this hotel when it was a Comfort Inn, but when I went to book it this time I discovered that it had been elevated to Clarion status and that it now had a silly name. Still, I looked forward to the stay. The receptionist was lounging behind the desk talking on the phone, using one of those ear and mouth piece things, so I could not tell whether he was talking to me or to someone on the phone. He was certainly very curt. On the way from the car to my room, I passed sacks of rubbish, the carpet from a car boot (trunk) drying out on a bench and what looked like an old supermarket trolley stuffed under the stairs. The room was okay, but I should have asked for one with a balcony. Breakfast was one of the most basic I have ever had at an American hotel (except perhaps for a Super 8) and the same receptionist was still talking on the phone and didn't even speak to me when I checked out. They need to so something about the breakfast, keeping the grounds free of rubbish and getting a new man or woman on reception.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at the Lodge at Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: mogo12
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Lodge at Calistoga and had a great experience. I was traveling with several friends, we had gone on a road trip for a few days, and were ending the trip with some relaxation and wine tasting in Calistoga/Napa. 6 of us stayed in 3 rooms, and all of us had a very nice and comfortable experience from begining to end. While driving to the hotel at night, we were confused about the directions we had obtained from google maps, so I called the Lodge, twice, and they were extremely helpful in giving us directions, as well as different options, explaining which routes were fastest, and which were more winding roads, etc. Once we arrived we were greeted well, everyone was friendly, and the check-in process was very fast. We were given some restaurant suggestions for dinner, and the main part of the town of Calistoga is very close, so it was very easy to get there (walkable even). Our stay in the rooms at night was very comfotable. Everything was clean, and the beds were especially comfy, and everyone commented on how well they slept. It was a particularly cold night, but the heaters worked well and we were all cozy in the rooms. In the morning the lobby had a very nice breakfast with bagels, cereal, muffins, etc. and freshly made waffles and breakfast burritos. The fireplace had a nice fire, so I sat and had coffee there and read until the rest of my group woke up. There was also a computer with internet access available for use. Again, the staff was extremely helpful and friendly, and gave me suggestions on wineries, spas, and restaurants. They even gave us passes and discount cards to several of the wineries, which we used later in the day. Before checking out, all of us used the pool and hot tub, as well as the sauna and steam room. There were even robes in the rooms for all of us to use which was a nice touch. As I said earlier, we had a great overall experience, and I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: MLZZimmer
Reviews.Content: I honestly do not know where to start with this hotel/motel! My husband and I as well as another couple we were traveling with booked this hotel on Expedia for 1 night in May while visiting Napa. When we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted promptly and given our 2 room keys. Once my husband and I opened the door to our room we noticed the a/c was broken and partially knocked off the wall. I also quickly glanced around the room and noticed the stains on the comforter, carpets and just a plain dirty room. I will say, I am a picky person, as typically in Napa we stay at the Candlelight Inn which is amazing, but during this stay we couldn;t get a room due to only needing 1 night accomodation, so we thought we would give this hotel a chance. I quickly went down to the front desk and told the girl that the room did not have an operable a/c unit and we were not happy with the cleaniless of the hotel, room, green swimming pool, etc.. She gave us another room key, before we even entered that room, I decided I didn't want to even chance the germs we might catch at this place and opted just to leave. I went back downstairs and told them it did not meet Clarion standards and I was highly disappointed in the cleaniless of this hotel and I was checking out and wanted my reservation cancelled. She cancelled my reservation as well as our friends, and gave me a piece of paper showing I am cancelled. We immeditaley called the Marriott in Napa and was able to book a room. Months later, I am still fighting with this hotel to reimburse the charge on my card (my friends were never charged just ours) as well as American Express is fighting with this hotel- they have repeately commented stating our a/c was not broken, and they kindly moved us and we choose not to stay and they couldn't re-rent the room and that is why they are charging us.. We never entered the other room, and the a/c was broken, this is the worst hotel experience I have ever had, and we typically stay at Marriott's , Westin's and while in vegas even The Wynn- this is inexcusable and I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. Please contact me if you have any questions. Stay away, not worth it! Michele

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in a Beautiful Town”
Reviews.Author: Equity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lodge at Calistoga for three nights, July 5-7, 2008. Our room was comfortable, though I thought that the pillows were too hard. Softer pillows would have been a better touch. The room had no outstanding amenities, everything was pretty much standard. but we had no complaints. AC worked great as it was over 100 degrees every day we were there. Location is just outside of a short walk to downtown Calistoga. Breakfast buffet was substandard compared with similar properties we have stayed in. Waffles were undercooked, no eggs or meats, minimal fresh fruit. We had breakfast in town at Sarafornia's our second and third days there and it was well worth the extra expense. Pool and hot tub were ok, nothing great. Pretty little courtyard between the rooms. Maid service was fast. Front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful. The main reason I chose this hotel was participation in Choice Privileges rewards program.

Reviews.Title: “Very neat, clean motel”
Reviews.Author: DebWaid
Reviews.Content: We just happened upon this very nice motel while touring Napa Valley. It is very neat and clean. There is a a continental breakfast. There is a sauna, pool and hot tub. The pool and hot tub are mineral water and supplied from underground springs, which makes the pool warm, which we enjoyed. The town of Calistoga is pretty, has cute shops and plenty of nice restaurants. We toured Berringer Winery, which was close, as were many other wineries.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodation in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: conniemcl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the weekend of March 15 at The Lodge, which we booked on a day's notice. The Wine Country was at its best, with all the flowering fruit trees and wildflowers in bloom and the hills and vineyards in their fresh spring greens. The Lodge itself is on the quiet outskirts of Calistoga and the rooms layed out in such a way that we were unaware of traffic on the road or in the parking lot. The hotel property contains many flowering trees which were lavishly showering drifts of petals. I had long pleasant soaks in the geothermally-heated spa, which was pleasantly warm and did not smell like chlorine. The relaxing atmosphere was enhanced by the Certa pillowtop mattress, which was the most comfortable hotel bed I ever slept in. We enjoyed freshly-made waffles provided as part of the coimplimentary continental breakfast - a lovely touch. The staff was firendly and attentive and cheerfully mailed back to me the clothes I left behind in the room. At the end of our stay we were remarking to each other what a terrific place this was, and decided to make a stay at The Lodge an annual spring event .

Reviews.Title: “Great Napa Find”
Reviews.Author: cdom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lodge at Calistoga during our first, but quick trip to the wine country. I was concerned about some of the bad reviews, but couldn't find anything comparable to the price (119/night!). The hotel had all you could ask for and more for the class of hotel and great price. Great location, friendly staff, great breakfast, clean room, relaxing hot tub, free wi/fi and comfy bed. We will definitely stay there again! One recommendation would be to request a room at the back of the property if you are a late sleeper - the traffic gets loud around 6:00am.

Reviews.Title: “Good value with many amenities”
Reviews.Author: bernaisesauce
Reviews.Content: This property provides most of what any traveler would need: comfortable beds, cable TV, balcony with vineyard view, convenient parking, friendly service and a really nice shower. It is priced lower than other properties in its class in the valley, and is still convenient to any place you might want to visit. We would return here because we had no complaints and enjoyed the peace and quiet of the area.

Reviews.Title: “World class rip-off”
Reviews.Author: baitieo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Lodge at Calistoga and could not wait to write this review. We were given a few choices for places to stay for a weekend wedding. Two of the choices were the Lodge at Calistoga and the Silverado Resort. Seeing as the rate for the Silverado was less than the Lodge, we were not too disappointed with not getting-in to the Silverado. Wow was that a mistake. For those who have not figured out, the Lodge is a fancy name for a Motel. If they gave awards for internet PR campaigns, this place would win. After seeing the website and doing minimal research it looked fine. Upon checking in, we knew we were in for the classic Motel 6 experience. The pool is gross, forget the long "Geothermal Hot Springs Mineral Pool" description. It is a normal motel pool. Using fancy words changes nothing. The breakfast is the kind of thing you get at a Comfort Inn...oh yeah...that's right...this was a Comfort Inn (the room trash cans still say Comfort Inn). Let me say that for a motel, it was not a bad place, but for a $250 per night room, it is a rip off...particularly when the beautiful Silverado was less then $200 pernight. You should get what you pay for...not here.

Reviews.Title: “A Health Hazard...mold spores spewing from A/C”
Reviews.Author: cloud9coastal
Reviews.Content: The outside is the bait...looks very nice and the Clarion Collection brand name is hiding a nightmare for the unsuspecting traveler. Buyer beware when you check into the room and smell the musty A/C spewing mold spores in the air. This place is a health hazard! I reported them to the Chamber of Commerce. I took the dried green balls of mold sitting in the vents of the A/C to the hotel front desk. This is not a housekeeping issue by their maids, but rather lack of proper routine A/C maintenance by an A/C company they would hire. I asked to be moved to another room with a newer A/C unit and was told that they were all the same. Not knowing if there would be another place in town to stay at the last minute, since this is high season, I asked for a discount (clerk would check with mgr). I left and found another room at the EuroSpa & Inn (very nice accommodations by the way), so went back to cancel my room at The Lodge at Calistoga. The front desk clerk said the mgr would honor a 10% discount! (The room was already overpriced at $152 a night. with my Access membership..I stayed at the Best Western Stevenson Manor the night before (great accommodations across the street) and paid $128 with my Access membership). Needless to say the 10% offering was a slap in the face. I told the clerk I would not stay there...period, discount or no discount! She did not charge me for the room even though it was outside their cancellation policy and showed me the note she wrote to her manager to let me know she had taken the situation seriously. The note indicated that she had "gotten several complaints about the musty rooms...isn't there something we can do?" The word in town with the locals I talked to during my 4 day stay in Calistoga is that the owner does not want to invest money back into the hotel to maintain it. IT SHOWS! DO NOT STAY AT THE LODGE AT CALISTOGA UNLESS YOU WANT TO LEAVE WITH A RESPIRATORY DISEASE(not to be confused with The Lodge at Indian Springs -which I don't know anything about). The Lodge at Calistoga should be shut down by the health dept until they get their A/C's cleaned on a regular basis by an air conditioning company Also, the mini-pool and jacuzzi look old with sun-bleached navy blue plastic lawn chairs that look "chaulky". I shudder to think how they maintain the pool water.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dhae
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from a 3-night stay at the Lodge at Calistoga. Apparently the hotel recently underwent a renovation and we loved our accommodations. The mattresses were fitted with unbelievably soft pillowtops and the grapevine design on the bedspread added to the charm. It seemed like everything in the room was new-new walls, fresh paint, new ceiling, new crown moulding, new carpet. The bathroom was clean and spacious (new tiling, too) and the crisp white bathrobes were a nice touch. We stayed on the second floor so we had a balcony facing the mountains. We were supplied coffee beans each morning to grind and use with the in-room coffee maker and to my relief, the room came with a fairly new black refrigerator. (The worn, brown fridges found in most hotels make me cringe.) The fresh belgium waffle breakfast was a welcome treat. Bagels, fruit, muffins, cereal, and juice were also on hand. The lady who checked us into our room when we arrived was nice and helpful, even suggesting a few restaurants. And when we sent the housekeeping lady away twice one morning because we weren't quite ready to leave the room yet, she left with a smile and returned with a smile. Sure you can find more luxurious accommodations, but they typically are twice the rate of The Lodge at Calistoga. (My room was around $200/night-including tax!) I intend to return to Napa and I will definitely stay at The Lodge at Calistoga.

Reviews.Title: “great location & great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bubbles911
Reviews.Content: Very nice location jusoff the trail in Calistoga. It was a great base for our wine tasting in northern Napa. Also well located (walking distance) to good restaurants. It was a rainy winter day so we didn't walk but could have. Nice comfortable room. Free wireless internet. Great breakfast (they make fresh waffles to order). Appeared to be ample parking. The pool was closed for renovations and they told us we could walk accorss the street to use theres, but again it was cold & rainy and I doubt anyone did. Bathrobes in the room. Check in & out were easy. Only problem was our key card stopped working day 2 but the girl at the desk remembered us & quickly fixed it. They recommended some restaurants (we really liked Brannans, but could have done without the micro brewery). And there was a fridge in the room which we liked for our yummy Brannans leftovers.

Reviews.Title: “Rude management”
Reviews.Author: MMDBayArea
Reviews.Content: The management decided to cancel our reservation at the last minute without so much as an attempt to contact us. The reservations were made back in December, and I had a written confirmation from them. They entered my credit card information incorrectly, and upon our arrival, they said the credit card was invalid. They had already given the room away, and made no attempt to apologize or help us find other accomodations for the night. Overall, their customer service is very poor.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump, with rude management to boot”
Reviews.Author: dasmoats
Reviews.Content: We, unfortunately, received a gift certificate for this hotel. Despite the fact that we told the reservations person this when we booked with the hotel, they refused to honor it. The manager/owner could not have been any ruder about it and basically accused us of having a fake gift certificate or some such nonsense. By the way, the "non-smoking" room smelled of cigarettes, and the "spa" was dirty. Yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else if you can ...”
Reviews.Author: calaifa
Reviews.Content: Our one day stay was far too long. The "hot mineral" pool and the jacuzzi were not only NOT even warm but they were both nasty. No wonder nobody was around the pool area. The breakfast was ok and the rooms were "motel" like quality. Just don't look under your mattress. The mattress boxspring was full of stains. We would never ever stay at this place again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great CHnges”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my wife and I have stayed at this hotel. However, it is no longer the Comfort Inn but The Lodge at Calistoga. We were told that there had been major changes to the hotel most having to do with the addition of a new courtyard seating area and upgraded rooms. We were pleased to find that the rooms were recently renovated and all additional seating had been added in the breakfast area. Overall this was a great stay. We will def stay again. -Paulasky's(Costa Mesa, CA) ---...its the new website

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: Dot Zall
Reviews.Content: ...The Comfort Inn in Calistoga was perfect for our stay... A good value, clean, decent room, comfortable bed....Mineral Pool, Mineral Hot Tub, Steam Room and Sauna were nice and we enjoyed them. The Mineral Pool is small but very warm and nice while we were there....and I spent a lot of time lounging in the hot tub. I felt like we were getting a bargain when I saw that some spas charge you just to come and swim in their mineral pools in Calistoga... Ask for a second floor room, as many of them have balconies. The breakfast was a basic continental breakfast with bagels and cereal but they also make fresh waffles for you (not frozen) and they were good! They are currently (4/2006) installing a Gas Firepit in the center courtyard which will be a nice gathering spot when completed. By the way, the best rate I got for this hotel was by calling the hotel directly. I look forward to staying here again. Calistoga is the best place to stay in the Napa Valley.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn Calistoga, Hot Springs of the West
HotelInfo.Address: 1865 Lincoln Ave, Calistoga, CA 94515
